byline.original: By PETER BAKER and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

abstract: News Analysis; Pres Obama continues to face daunting set of challenges in making nuclear deal with Iran stick while working to restore relationships with allies damaged during contentious international debates over the accord; supporters and critics alike acknowledge that Obama administration must begin to detail plans for enforcement of the agreement and for offsetting Iran's continued support for militant groups in Middle East.
lead_paragraph: Supporters and critics alike said Mr. Obama must detail how the United States and other world powers intend to enforce and monitor the nuclear agreement with Iran.

headline.main: Nuclear Deal Sealed, Obama Must Now Make It Work, and Mend Fences
headline.print_headline: Nuclear Deal Sealed, Obama Must Now Make It Work, and Mend Fences

snippet: Supporters and critics alike said Mr. Obama must detail how the United States and other world powers intend to enforce and monitor the nuclear agreement with Iran.
